newsitem.title: USA: Oracle to buy oil software from BP.
newsitem.headline: Oracle to buy oil software from BP.

text.p: Oracle Corp said Wednesday it plans to buy a specialized oil production software product from British Petroleum Co Plc. Terms were not disclosed.
The companies signed a letter of intent for Oracle to buy BP's ISP product, a computer program that tracks supply, distribution, sales and marketing and accounting of oil-production operations.
Oracle said it does not anticipate taking a charge against earnings in connection with the deal.
Oracle specializes in writing database software. It also sells add-on applications that track manufacturing, energy production and consumer packaged goods operations.
The acquisition is part of Oracle's strategy to beef up its line of oil software, the company said.
